scenarios.driverSummary: Higher acuity mix + specialty drug step-ups outpace utilization controls.
scenarios.interpretation: Spend growth driven by care getting more expensive; modest membership uptick.

scenarios.driverSummary: Balanced utilization normalization, negotiated unit cost glide path, stable membership.
scenarios.interpretation: Mix of more people using care and modest unit cost lift; trend near plan.

scenarios.driverSummary: Elective rebound + oncology prevalence + pharmacy trend at specialty tiers.
scenarios.interpretation: Both utilization and unit cost pressure; risk if rate negotiations slip.

datapoints: Inpatient/OP/Pro/Pharmacy claims by site of care
High-cost claimant tails and condition prevalence
Seasonality and rebound adjustments post deferrals
Enrollment mix by product and segment
Aging curve and chronic condition load
Unit cost escalators and inflation riders
On-the-ground feeds on outbreaks and severity
Hierarchical GLMs for utilization and unit cost
Gradient boosting for tail risk and case mix
Scenario overlays for policy and macro shocks

takeaway: You can see the historical climb, the forecast range, what drives the upside/downside, and which levers would move Total Projected Medical Spend.
